item.description:
Meet in front of "Fresh Side" at 5:30, go to the "Taste of Amherst" for dinner.

The "Taste" menu can be found at; http://www.meetup.com/filmgroup/files/

Then ...

The movie starts at 7:30. Anyone that wants to pass on dinner, we'll meet you at 7:15 in the theater's lobby, outside the rest rooms.

I remember reading about this a few years ago in the paper. It reminded me of "Drowning Mona" with Bette Midler and Danny DeVito, only real life. Today's NYT has the story "How My Aunt Marge Ended Up in the Deep Freeze";

http://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/15/magazine/how-my-aunt-marge-ended-up-in-the-deep-freeze.html?_r=1&ref=magazine

Mahnola Dargis' review is in today's NYT titled "A Small-Town Murder by Just the Nicest Guy";

http://movies.nytimes.com/2012/04/27/movies/bernie-with-jack-black-and-shirley-maclaine.html?ref=movies
